data.title: Best shot in BHAM area for authentic Chinese food
data.text: Really great food here and an intimate nice setting for a casual restaurant.  Best time to go is for lunch if you want some great deals that include the free soup and egg roll.  My only complaint is the hot mustard packs - this place is too good to go that route, it's like a great Italian place trying to use packaged parmesan cheese instead of fresh.  Make a change there and you have a 5 instead of a 4.

data.title: Authentic Chinese food
data.text: Found this restaurant on trip advisor.  Really good find.  Warm atmosphere, friendly service.  I had the shrimp in brown bean sauce.  So good.  The waitress recommended.  Large shrimp, cabbage, onions and peppers in a black bean sauce!!  We also ordered the crab Rangoon.  Best restaurant on our trip.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Choices for restaurants are limited in this area and Mr. Chen's was recommended. Small Chinese restaurant in a strip mall that serves traditional dishes fast, hot and well cooked. In a small town this is a good choice for a healthier option to fast food or Barbecue. Nothing fancy but decent food at a fair price.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: The sweet pea leaves were divine!  Both Mapo Tofu and House Tofu were excellent.  We have had their House Clay pot, also on a previous visit.  Their eggplant w/pork Basil in Hot Pot was delicious and plentiful enough that eve after two of use shared a serving (as a side dish) had plenty left for another meal.  I have had Many of their meat and fish dishes and they are all outstanding.  Service is attentive and as fast as can be expected and still have freshly prepared food.  I am excited to try their new Greensprings location since it's closer to my home.  The supermarket on Greensprings is amazing!

data.title: Quick lunch very tasty
data.text: Heard good things all true! I had Mongolian beef and W had basil squid. Awesome!  We aren't doing the rice thing at the moment ( I heard you gasp) but truly it was just delish without the rice!

data.title: Poor Take-out experience. Go somewhere else.
data.text:
I went in on a Sunday at 13:16 and ordered 2 lunch specials - Mongolian Beef with white rice and Kung Pao Chicken with Egg Fried Rice (Total $15.16). The place was busy and the wait staff seemed to be overwhelmed with comments about waiting for food and slow service. The plates coming out looked ok as far as I could tell. It took 25 minutes to get my order and 5 minutes or so to get back to my hotel. There were no utensils, napkins or sauce included (the sauce was on the counter). There is an option to order online.

When I opened the bag, I was disappointed with the presentation.
They used a styrofoam box and included the small egg rolls in with the cooked food. Now everyone knows if you put fried food in an enclosure with other to food (especially in styrofoam) it steams the fried food (which is why every other chinese take-out I have ever had puts the egg rolls in a wax-type bag), so they were soggy. In the case of the Mongolian Beef the egg roll was swimming in a pool of meat sauce and inedible.

The Kung Pao Chicken was almost chopped meat - small pieces along with zucchini (really?) and mushrooms along with very small pieces of chinese red peppers which really don't test well when chewed, so there was a laborious task of finding all of these 2-3 cm  mines. Very salty. The sauce was spicy and peanuts crunchy - other than that is was far from this dish I have had in other places. The Egg Fried Rice - meh - kind of boring and a little oily - some small scrambled egg pieces, 4 carrot cubes and 3 peas

The Mongolian Beef was overwhelmingly onion tasting with a mixture of regular and green onions. The sauce was thin, slightly sweet.

I really had a hard time deciding if this was terrible or poor. Since I was able to eat SOME of it I chose poor. I would not go back. Perhaps the eat-in experience is different, but I will never know.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Food this place on Trip Advisor. Loved the food and the server was attentive and pleasant. I would recommend!

data.title: Authentic Chinese!
data.text:
This was our first visit to this restaurant at lunch.(We have been to the Tuscaloosa
restaurant many times). So glad to find this restaurant in Hoover. This is the real deal.They have dishes on their menu that are quite interesting. I haven't been brave enough to check any of them out. I usually stick to shrimp with vegetables and it was good. My husband had the Kung Pao chicken and he said it was really good. We both asked for the red chili paste to spice up both of our dishes. (Use sparingly because it is quite hot). We also ordered the seafood hot and sour soup and it was  delicious. I have read other reviews that say the food is not spicy or is bland. I learned by going to the Tuscaloosa restaurant that it is best to ask for the red chili to add to the dish yourself. I made the mistake of ordering shrimp with vegetables spicy! It was so spicy that I could not eat it. The manager brought me out another order and told me to ask for the chili next time. That is what we always do and our dishes are always spiced to our liking! The food and service were good. We will definitely return to try some of their other dishes. The only negative about this restaurant is that it is quite small and when the door opened, it was quite chilly. (Carry a sweater if you visit on a cold day)  If you are craving real Chinese food, give this restaurant a try!

data.title: First Visit and a DEFINITE  New Customer!
data.text: Went here with my sister to celebrate her birthday.  A friend had said it was great and she was spot on. This is REAL Chinese food.  Everything we got was wonderful and the portions were so large we had take home enough for another meal!  Servers were so nice and always smiling.  We were smiling, too, as we enjoyed our beautiful meal.

data.title: Good Lunch
data.text: Have been looking for a new Chinese restaurant. We did a large take out order for lunch for the office. Food was good, all of us got different dishes. 1 plate did not get rice or an egg roll. We are still on the fence as to going back or not.

data.title: Best Chinese in Birmingham!!
data.text: I never miss an opportunity to go to Mr. Chen's.  I have never had a bad dish and the basil eggplant with pork in a hotpot is one of my favorite dishes in all of Birmingham.  Whatever you do, do not order off the back of the menu - ask the server what is best and fresh and go with it.  Sometimes you will be lucky enough to hear about a new, off the menu item.

data.title: Great place for lunch
data.text: I have really missed having really good Chinese food since my favorite restaurant closed.  Food was fresh, very tasty.  Service was excellent.  Plan to have dinner there soon.

data.title: Get the Steamed Dumplings!!!
data.text: This was our first visit and we were impressed with the food and the service.  The steamed dumplings were absolutely divine; the best we've ever had! I had the Eggplant with Garlic and my husband chose the Pineapple Shrimp, and both dishes were so tasty. The light breading of the pineapple and the huge, clean shrimp were sheer simple goodness. Our server, Chris, was attentive and so personable, willing to share his food recommendations and brief tidbits of his travels. If you order egg or spring rolls, ask for the house sauces, rather than the packaged sauces on the table.  The only drawback for us was that they do not serve wine, only beer. However, our beers were good, with ice cold mugs! We'll become regulars here; it was that good.

data.title: Best Chinese!
data.text: This is our go to place for excellent, quality Chinese cuisine. We've never had a bad experience when it comes to the food, whether dine in or take away. Can get crowded though.

data.title: Amazing place
data.text: I had heard of Mr Chens for the last few months and was not disappointed. The food is incredible and the service is fast and professional. The restaurant is simple but very clean and comfortable. 5stars!

data.title: Really is Authentic Chinese
data.text: Very extensive menu with lots of options.  Had the sizzling beef which was excellent.  Service was very good.  Was very busy but we were seated quickly.  Was a little noisy.  I would repeat.

data.title: The best around
data.text: As the other reviewers have stated, this is the most authentic food I've had. The staff is great and the atmosphere is comfortable.

data.title: Best Chinese in B'ham
data.text: This is the best Chinese offering in Birmingham that I know of.  Nothing fancy, just some solid Chinese offerings without a lot of hype!  The Pineapple Shrimp will blow you away!  Check it out!!

data.title: As close as it Gets
data.text: I am always amused when any restaurant says they offer authentic food. Chinese, Mexican, Thai, and even Bar B Q. When it comes to Chinese or Mexican I tend to think you have to be dinning at a friends home in Shanghai or Mexico City. Then you may experience authentic cuisine unless that day they choose to show off their French. Mr. Chen's is very good and maybe very close to authentic but I have never dined in Shanghai so I have nothing to compare to. But when I want Chinese food this is the first place I think of so they do something right. I have had both lunch and dinner here several time and never been disappointed with the food or service. The prices are very reasonable the service is always quick and you get the feel of being in a Chinese restaurant on the mainland China. As a local place in Hoover which is a suburb of Birmingham the food stands out way above the other Chinese establishments, including the Red Pearl. One great thing is they have a very large parking lot so parking is never a problem. Staying downtown for a visit your drive would be about 15 minutes depending on traffic and the location is easy to find. It's located in a good area and I usually feel very safe when in this area of the city. The dinner menu offers more and interesting items but you can order dinner items off the usual lunch items. But the prices on the lunch menu are so reasonable and the food so good why spend more money. If you are a local resident or just visiting the city for a few days you will not be disappointed with Mr. Chen's Authentic Chinese.

data.title: Great Authentic Chinese Food with quick service
data.text: Went with my daughter, who demanded it as one of her first places to go when she came home from overseas. Ordered, Beef and Noodles, Pork with Black Beans, and Small Steam Buns. The beef was spoon tender. Black Bean Pork was a tad salty, but very good. Small Steam Buns were an absolute treat. They also have bubble tea, which is so hard to find in Bham. You can't go wrong unless you show up Sunday after church and you have to wait for a table.
